title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 5, ch. XIV, pt. 142 - Requirements And Procedures Regarding Participation By Certified Minority- And Women-owned Business Enterprises On State Contracts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 5, ch. XIV, pt. 142 - Requirements And Procedures Regarding Participation By Certified Minority- And Women-owned Business Enterprises On State Contracts

State Regulations
§ 142.1 - Purpose, scope and applicability
§ 142.2 - Establishing contract goals and identifying subcontract opportunities for certified businesses
§ 142.3 - Diversity practices, bidding and award considerations
§ 142.4 - Utilization plans
§ 142.5 - Posting of utilization plans
§ 142.6 - Submission and review of utilization plans
§ 142.7 - Waivers
§ 142.8 - Contractor's efforts to utilize certified business enterprises
§ 142.9 - Contractor disqualification
§ 142.10 - Contractor compliance reporting
§ 142.11 - Contractor compliance reports
§ 142.12 - Contractor and State agency complaints
§ 142.13 - Provisions in contracts; violations; and debarment
§ 142.14 - Quantitative scoring factors for State contracts

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 5, ch. XIV, pt. 142

Statutory authority: Executive Law, §§ 313[2], [2-a], 313-a

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
